page.title: 13FARMING - OWERSBY - ARABLE
page.content: The largest and most intensive arable farm in the area covers 2,200 acres including about a quarter of the block The biggest field is 207 acres, the smallest less than 1.It is worked by 8 men and a foreman using 11 tractors ranging from 75hp-230hp - very useful machines to clear the roads as comm- unity service in snowy weather.This year about 450 acres of oilseed rape, 1200 acres of wheat and 400 acres of barley were grown, and harvested by 4 MF760 combine harvesters,the men work- ing up to 15 hours a day,7 days a week The crops are sprayed an average of 5 times within the year (twice with a herbicide,twice with a fungicide and once with an insecticide) using half- tracks with 52ft boom sprays.Aerial spraying has been abandoned as being less cost effective.
